channel.title: What book do you recommend?
channel.description:
tl;dr What book do you recommend for me to get that teaches about Java and can benefit me for RuneScape Private Servers? inb4 "Java: The Good Parts" by Jim Waldo
Helloooo everyone! Long time no see. :P So recently with the wildy and trade being brought back to RuneScape, I couldn't resist playing again. And after sitting there listening to some Tom Petty and nostalgia'ing hardcore, I thought back to the days of RuneScape Private Servers. For Christmas I got a book called "Java: The Good Parts" by Jim Waldo from O'Reilly because I knew at some point I'd get interested in RSPS again, but I was wondering if you recommended a better book on Java. You see, I completely forgot everything about Java and so I decided to get a book, but as I previously said, I want to know if you would recommend an even better book on Java.
Thanks!

item.title: What book do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Around the World In Eighty Days, by Jules Verne.
srsly?

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


Has a lot of good books. I’m using “Sams Teach Yourself Java 6 In 21 Days” but I’ve heard “Bleeding From The Keyboard” is good as well.

Read full topic

item.description:
@gbaum wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]http://amazing-apps.com/uploads/JavaProgrammingBooksCollection.rar

Credits to John459 for torrenting them and hosting them. (Originally for me, but it’s publicly available.)[/quote]

I was just about to post a topic with the same question and saw this. Thanks dude!

item.title: What book do you recommend?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I haven’t even finished one book. It’s a lot of wonderful information

It also helps if you takes notes. (Sounds boring, but it’s worth it in the long run.)[/quote]
As long as there is useful information to be learned, I’m all for it
And notes are no problem

Read full topic

Seems a tad outdated don’tcha think?
[/quote]

When the fuck did knowledge become outdated?[/quote]
I mean Java has updated quite a bit since '98 hasn’t it?
